notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat JBoss Fuse 6.3 and Red Hat JBoss A-MQ 6.3.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Fuse provides a small-footprint, flexible, open source enterprise service bus and integration platform. Red Hat A-MQ is a standards compliant messaging system that is tailored for use in mission critical applications.

This patch is an update to Red Hat Fuse 6.3 and Red Hat A-MQ 6.3. It includes bug fixes, which are documented in the patch notes accompanying the package on the download page. See the download link given in the references section below.

Security fix(es):

* commons-beanutils: apache-commons-beanutils: does not suppresses the class property in PropertyUtilsBean by default (CVE-2019-10086)

* Camel: server-side template injection and arbitrary file disclosure on templating components (CVE-2020-11994)

* hawtio: server side request forgery via initial /proxy/ substring of a URI (CVE-2019-9827)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat JBoss Fuse/A-MQ 6.3 R17 security and bug fix update

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: Hawt Hawtio through 2.5.0 is vulnerable to SSRF, allowing a remote attacker to trigger an HTTP request from an affected server to an arbitrary host via the initial /proxy/ substring of a URI.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: hawtio: server side request forgery via initial /proxy/ substring of a URI
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1728604: CVE-2019-9827 hawtio: server side request forgery via initial /proxy/ substring of a URI

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

Installation instructions are located in the download section of the customer portal.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-9827 hawtio: server side request forgery via initial /proxy/ substring of a URI

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Apache Commons BeanUtils, where the class property in PropertyUtilsBean is not suppressed by default. This flaw allows an attacker to access the classloader.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: apache-commons-beanutils: does not suppresses the class property in PropertyUtilsBean by default
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: A flaw was found in camel. Camel's templating components are suseptable to Server-Side Template Injection and arbitrary file disclosure.  The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: camel: server-side template injection and arbitrary file disclosure on templating components
